incidents.name: Issues passing Challenge Pages and Turnstile

incident_updates.body: Between July 8th 11:00 UTC and July 9th 02:09AM UTC, visitors may have experienced issues passing Challenge Pages and Turnstile challenges. Users may have been unable to complete a challenge, resulting in failure to proceed.
This incident has been resolved.

Some Cloudflare services like Cloudflare Dashboard and Cloudflare API were unavailable between 11:12 and 11:20 UTC. Cloudflare is investigating the issue.

We are working to analyse and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Cache Purge Failures and Dashboard Errors

incident_updates.body: Customers using the Dashboard/Cloudflare APIs between 16:18 UTC and 16:29 UTC may have seen elevated errors on the dashboard and when trying to purge cache by tag/prefix/host and everything.
We have restored a batch of accounts, and we will continue to respond individual instances of deactivated legitimate accounts.
We continue to make progress and are close to restoring our first batch of accounts.
We have begun the process to return the impacted accounts to active.
We have identified the impacted accounts and are working on a resolution.

As part of Cloudflare's ongoing efforts to address suspected malicious activity, we have received reports that we may have improperly deactivated some legitimate accounts.  We are actively working on this.  Updates will follow shortly

Cloudflare is researching an issue with multiple users trying to login and not able to do so.

Updates will follow shortly.

These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

incidents.name: API Tokens for R2 buckets access issue

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've deployed a fix to our IAM propagation improving message throughput, and the message queue is currently decreasing.

We've identified an issue with token propagation affecting API token delegation to the R2 service. Newly created tokens will be delayed in functioning. We're working to resolve the issue, and tokens created will begin functioning properly once resolved.
Cloudflare is investigating a problem in token authentication for newly created API token for R2 buckets access. Existing tokens will work as usual.

incidents.name: Degradation Issues with Bring Your Own IP (BYOIP) / Bring Your Own IP On-Demand feature

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare investigated issues with Bring Your Own IP (BYOIP) / Bring Your Own IP (BYOIP) On-Demand feature.

BYOIP advertisement/withdrawal API requests were degraded 2024-06-12 16:31 thru 17:01 UTC

Impact is restricted to changes in the Bring Your Own IP (BYOIP) configuration and it does not affect any connectivity, security or CDN functionality.
